docs.lead_paragraph: Almost every health care proposal still pending in Congress complies with the politically potent demand -- expressed over and over in last month's Senate debate -- that all Americans should be able to get insurance as good as what Congress has. In fact, there is no special health plan for members of Congress. They participate in the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program, along with nine million other Government workers, retirees and dependents.

headline.main: Health Care Debate to Shift To Federal Employees' Plan

docs.lead_paragraph: AMONG the most intractable symptoms of schizophrenia are those that are the most subtle, including social withdrawal, emotional flatness and apathy, which do not respond to most existing medications. But new studies are finding that very large doses of a form of glycine, a common amino acid, may offer relief from these "negative" symptoms. The finding, reported in the August issue of The American Journal of Psychiatry, is potentially of great importance, because the negative symptoms are more persistent than the more blatant ones, like delusions and hallucinations, and account for some of the most debilitating long-term effects of the disorder.

headline.main: Amino Acid Offers Hope of Relieving Milder Symptoms Of Schizophrenia
